body: this was not a problem before, because normally we store the key values in `shadowValueBuffer` which is typed as `object[]` as well (and so `ValueBufferTryReadValue` calls for key values are typed as `object` already), or (in case of NoTracking) we don't need to materialize the keys, since they are all in shadow state for JSON entities.

issue.title: Fix to #30244 - Json column fails to materialize only when default interceptor used

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.

issue.body:
Problem was that when we build materializer expression, ValueBufferTryReadValue call that extracts values of keys is typed with key's CLR type. This fails for json as we visit the materializer expression, because calls to ValueBufferTryReadValue are replaced with array accesses to object[] that we store key values in. We should be using ValueBufferTryReadValue<object> when trying to get value for keys, like we do everywhere else, so that after the visitation expression types are correct.

Fixes #30244

issue.title: IMaterializationInterceptor failing when using JSON owned type

repository.name: efcore
repository.description: EF Core is a modern object-database mapper for .NET. It supports LINQ queries, change tracking, updates, and schema migrations.
